transportAdvice: Manchester has an extensive public transit network including trams, buses, and trains that connect the city centre to surrounding areas and major attractions, making it easy to get around without a car. The city centre is walkable for most tourist areas, and taxis are widely available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and frequently wet with short daylight hours, typical of a northern English winter.
Still cold and damp with occasional frost, though days begin to lengthen slightly.
Early spring brings milder temperatures but rain remains common and winds can be brisk.
Noticeably warmer with longer days, though showers are still frequent and a jacket is advisable.
Pleasant spring weather with more sunshine, though rain can still interrupt outdoor plans.
Warm and generally pleasant, one of the better months to visit with longer evenings.
The warmest month of the year, though showers remain possible and temperatures rarely get very hot.
Similar to July with warm temperatures and a mix of sunshine and occasional rain.
Early autumn brings cooler evenings but still comfortable daytime temperatures.
Noticeably cooler and wetter as autumn sets in, with shorter days and frequent overcast skies.
Cold and grey with regular rainfall, marking the onset of the northern winter.
Cold and wet with the shortest days of the year, though festive markets and events liven up the city.
